Event.0: BC The Mesoamerican Long Count calendar, used by several pre-Columbian Mesoamerican civilizations, notably the Mayans, begins
Event.1: American comedian and actor Robin Williams, who was known for his manic stand-up routines and his diverse film performances, committed suicide.
Event.2: NATO takes over command of the peacekeeping force in Afghanistan, marking its first major operation outside Europe in its 54-year-history.
Event.3: The Major League Baseball Players Association began a labour strike following the games of August 11, and the dispute eventually led to the cancellation of the remainder of the season, including the World Series.
Event.4: Director Oliver Stone files for divorce from Elizabeth
Event.5: Al-Qaeda formed at a meeting between Osama bin Laden, Zawahiri and Dr Fadl in Peshawar, Pakistan
Event.6: At the Olympic Games in Los Angeles, Carl Lewis became the third track-and-field athlete to win four gold medals in one Olympics, joining fellow Americans Alvin Kraenzlein (1900) and Jesse Owens (1936).
Event.7: "C'est Chic" 2nd studio album by Chic is released featuring single "Le Freak" (Billboard Album of the Year 1979)
Event.8:
Viola Davis
American actress
was born
Event.9: Race riots erupted in the Watts district of Los Angeles, resulting in the deaths of 34 people.
Event.10:
David Brooks
American journalist and commentator
was born
Event.11:
Jackson Pollock killed in automobile accident
American painter Jackson Pollock, a leading exponent of Abstract Expressionism who received great fame and serious recognition for his radical poured, or “drip,” technique, died this day in 1956 in an automobile accident.
Event.12: Formal peace treaty ends over 7 yrs of fighting in Indochina between the French and the Communist Viet Minh
Event.13:
Steve Wozniak
American electronics engineer
was born
Event.14: Molecular biologist Francis Crick (33) weds artist Odile Speed (29)
Event.15: Allies refuse Japan's offer to surrender on the condition that Emperor Hirohito retains his status
Event.16: "The Life of Emile Zola" directed by William Dieterle and starring Paul Muni premieres in New York (Best Picture 1938)
Event.17:
Jerry Falwell
American minister
was born
Event.18: Babe Ruth becomes 1st professional baseball player to hit 500 homers (off Willis Hudlin of Cleveland Indians)
Event.19: Physicist James Chadwick (33) weds Aileen Stewart-Brown
Event.20: The first newsreel of U.S. presidential candidates, which included footage of Calvin Coolidge, John W. Davis, and Robert La Follette, was filmed.
Event.21: Alex Haley, an African American writer best known for The Autobiography of Malcolm X (1965) and Roots: The Saga of an American Family (1976), was born in Ithaca, New York.
Event.22: The Weimar constitution was formally declared, establishing Germany as a republic.
Event.23:
Enid Blyton
British author
was born
Event.24: Education pioneer Booker T. Washington (30) weds Olivia Davidson (32) Athens, Ohio
